If you dont like these stats you may do 27-point buy with this calculator: http://1-dot-encounter-planner.appspot.com/point-buy-calculator.html

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCC8zXWnXUzinvvkxqo_description
attribs.current:
Make a token on http://rolladvantage.com/tokenstamp/ upload the token as your character image, and change the character name with this format:

PC Name (Game ID)

This is so the character can be assigned to you and a token can be made even while you are offline. if you fail to follow these instructions the character will eventually get deleted.

attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current: Always seem very calm no matter the situation

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current: Everyone should be free to pursue his or her livelihood

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current: When I see something valuable, I cant help but start planning a heist.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFUKiO57kLVfmRKHTD3_description
attribs.current: You have a reliable and trustworthy contact who acts as your liaison to a loose network of other criminals. (This is not a formal organization like the Zhentarim.) You know how to get messages to and from your contact, even over great distances, using local messnegers, corrupt caravan masters, and seedy sailors who can deliver messages for you.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LFYIa74dlyEBjUSvhhv_itemcontent
attribs.current: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LFYIvnYNhMjpcnVvxi0_itemname
attribs.current: dark common clothes including a hood

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LFYJFeqinyK1VO6M9XO_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d8, Damage Type: Piercing

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LFYJMlVZh25ABVC4UHG_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon (see "Improvised Weapons" later in the section). A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LFYJMlVZh25ABVC4UHG_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Ranged Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 80/320

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LFYJPXOkTcl6J8YNfd8_itemcontent

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LFYJmclwAM-3Tm0Cvb8_itemcontent
attribs.current: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFYKNZgYaMra6-Drpt3_description
attribs.current:
At 1st level, choose two of your skill proficiencies, or one of your skill proficiencies and your proficiency with Thieves' Tools. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.

At 6th level, you can choose two more of your proficiencies (in Skills or with thieves' tools) to gain this benefit.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFYRMpZrKFxhMjpwFRE_description
attribs.current:
Beginning at 1st level, you know how to strike subtly and exploit a foe's distraction. Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage to one creature you hit with an Attack if you have advantage on the Attack roll. The Attack must use a Finesse or a ranged weapon.

You don't need advantage on the Attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't Incapacitated, and you don't have disadvantage on the Attack roll.

The amount of the extra damage increases as you gain levels in this class, as shown in the Sneak Attack column of the Rogue table.
